name: MDLPhysicallyPlausibleScatteringFunction
desc: A set of material properties that describes a physically realistic shading model for materials.

items.name: var subsurface: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The degree to which light scatters under the surface of the material.

items.name: var metallic: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The degree to which the material appears as a dielectric surface (lower values) or as a metal (higher values).

items.name: var specularAmount: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The tendency of the material to generate specular highlights.

items.name: var specularTint: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The balance of color for specular highlights, between the light color (lower values) and the material’s base color (at higher values).

items.name: var roughness: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The degree to which a material appears smooth, affecting both diffuse and specular response.

items.name: var anisotropic: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The degree to which specular highlights elongate in the direction of the local tangent basis.

items.name: var anisotropicRotation: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The angle at which anisotropic effects are rotated relative to the local tangent basis.

items.name: var sheen: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The intensity of highlights that appear only at glancing angles on a material’s surface.

items.name: var sheenTint: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The balance of color for highlights that appear only at glancing angles, between the light color (lower values) and the material’s base color (at higher values).

items.name: var clearcoat: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The intensity of a second specular highlight, similar to the gloss that results from a clear coat on an automotive finish.

items.name: var clearcoatGloss: MDLMaterialProperty
items.desc: The sharpness of a second specular highlight, similar to the gloss that results from a clear coat on an automotive finish.
